page.title: 18MEDIA NEWSPAPERS & T.V.
page.content: Dornoch's most popular daily newspaper is the Daily Record. The local paper is the Northern Times which is based in Golspie. The parish news is printed by the Church of Scotland and can be purchased at the cathedral. The Sunday Post is the most popular Sunday paper in our block. The T.V.Times is bought by many families. Many women purchase Womens Own. There is quite a variety of magazines the most popular being the computer ones. For boys the most popular comic is the Beano. The girls tend to buy different comics. Overall Look-in is the most popular with both. Most people watch evening T.V. The average daily time spent watching T.V. is 4-5 hours. Videos are quiet popular and tapes can be hired locally for Â£2 per evening. Some people own computers which they use mainly for games. Most people have radios in their cars.
